qas.question: What was the new form of writing introduced by the spread of Islam?
When did usage of Middle Persian script fall off?
What script was converted to Latin in the 1920s?
When was Tajik script converted to Cyrillic?
Who catalyzed the conversion of Tajik script into Cyrillic?
The spread of what religion introduce the Persian script?
When did the use of middle Persian script begin?
When was Arabic script converted to Latin?
What's began the conversion of Arabic script to Cyrillic?

context: The <b5_0>Islam<b5_0/>ic conquest also brought with it the adoption of <a0_0>Arabic script<a0_0/> for writing Persian and much later, Kurdish, Pashto and Balochi. All three were adapted to the writing by the addition of a few letters. This development probably occurred some time during the <a1_0>second half of the <b6_0>8th century<b6_0/><a1_0/>, when the old middle Persian script began dwindling in usage. The Arabic script remains in use in contemporary modern Persian. <a2_0>Tajik script<a2_0/> was first Latinised in the <b7_0>1920s<b7_0/> under the then <b8_0>Soviet nationality policy<b8_0/>. The script was however subsequently Cyrillicized in <a3_0>the 1930s<a3_0/> by <a4_0>the Soviet government<a4_0/>.
